title: My Successful KDP Keyword Research Method for Amazon Book Publishing

tactics.name: manual_keyword_research
tactics.description: Create a spreadsheet of keywords by gathering Amazon search suggestions and analyzing search volume/competition
steps: Use Chrome plugins (DS Amazon Quick View, AMZ Suggestion Expander) to collect keyword suggestions
Input niche terms into Amazon search bar to get search result counts
Record keywords and their search volume in a spreadsheet
Filter keywords with <1000 search results for low competition
caveats: Avoid keywords with high competition unless using Amazon Ads
source_quotes: Keyword research is vital if you want to be successful and profitable in this online publishing business.

tactics.name: BSR and Search Volume Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keyword viability using bestseller ranks and Amazon search volume data from tools like Publisher Rocket.
steps: Use Keywords Everywhere to check Google search volume
Check Amazon Quickview for BSR of top books
Use Publisher Rocket for estimated Amazon searches per month
caveats: BSR may reflect sales from other keywords
source_quotes: if there are three or more books with bestsellers ranks of less than 300,000 on the first page

heuristics.name: competition_filter
heuristics.condition: If search results < 1000, then prioritize for organic ranking chances
source_quotes: If the search results are less than a thousand... the competition is low enough to give you a good chance

heuristics.name: Sort by Search Volume
heuristics.condition: If keywords have higher Amazon searches and lower competition
source_quotes: the better, more potentially profitable keywords, will be those that have more searches per month and less competition

claims.statement: Successful Amazon book publishing begins with keyword research before book creation
source_quotes: The success of your book starts before you've even created and published your book. It starts in the keyword research phase

claims.statement: Amazon search volume metrics are derived from a formula but are reasonably accurate.
source_quotes: These are figures for amazon.com. The US site. It will give you the estimated Amazon searches per month and other useful metrics.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience segments with unique constraints for niche profitability
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity (target audience), problem (ADHD), and constraint (Christian) for precise keyword targeting
source_quotes: Take a look at my videos I've already uploaded. I've done many videos on them. In fact, I'll tell you about some very profitable ones at the end of the video.
